body:
> I mean the .class file lef tin the folder may on purpose, or just a garbage

This PR treats such `.class` file as garbage.
I have raised "NETBEANS-5831 Create a SQL Standard Quoter for Use with Connectionless Cases" to accomidate refactoring elements in the above.
I managed to squash the commits. Should be ready to merge.

@matthiasblaesing aside - check you're not using refs/pull for this https://docs.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-pull-requests/reviewing-changes-in-pull-requests/checking-out-pull-requests-locally#error-failed-to-push-some-refs

@nigjo I saw the squash yesterday, but the automatic tests were not yet green - fixed now. As before: I assume you are the author of the change and are aware, that you donate the changes to the ASF. Thank you.

@neilcsmith-net thank you for the pointer I might see where I went wrong, will try next time again.
Should I squash the commits @ebarboni?

> 
> 
> Maybe, We should also update this file: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/java/java.hints/licenseinfo.xml
> 
> @matthiasblaesing Aren't the license of png files checked via CI(RAT)?

@junichi11 should I go ahead and update the file?

> should I go ahead and update the file?

@mishrasandeep Yes. Let's update it for your new png files.
looks ok for me. Why do we still need 8.2 launchers?

> looks ok for me. Why do we still need 8.2 launchers?

These are still potentially used for the old pre-NB 7 platform applications.

> 
> 
> > should I go ahead and update the file?
> 
> @mishrasandeep Yes. Let's update it for your new png files.

@junichi11 have updated the license file
we did others changes and split repository for netbeans launcher; Build improvement should be handled in this repository https://github.com/apache/netbeans-native-launchers
I would say yes
hi @BradWalker would you try to merge using your commiter privilege?

> hi @BradWalker would you try to merge using your commiter privilege?

Hey @ebarboni , sorry to be such a slacker.. Busy summer with family.. I will get this done within the next day..

hi @ebresie would be good if you can squash and force push to "remove" from history the technical commit.

git rebase -i HEAD~20  (shoud match hash of you commits)
edit the file to replace pick by squash (except for the first)

edit commit message maybe choose the one with Issue number

apply the rebase

if everything is OK 
git push --force

@lkishalmi "da" was used elsewhere already (similar purpose) ;) and selected because "da" (Russian) = "yes" (english) && is a valid locale code (so you can actually do `new Locale("DA")` without an exception. Similar for "no", but for it NOrway locale came very handy :)
Oh functional cheating! I'm fine with that.
verify license is now ok.
No problemo, feel free to merge your others approved PR.

Forgive me, I have possibly forgotten everything about how this build works, but at the moment I cannot really see how `BUILDINFO.txt` would ever end up in that location?  From what I remember `BUILDINFO.txt` is only created when the build runs in GitHub Actions. 
(it is created in https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/.github/workflows/native-binary-build-lib.profiler.yml)  

Sure, if you take the ZIP with the build artifacts and explode into that dir then you'll have make sure not to commit it. Is that what you mean?

This bug also happen when you do not have access to the internet, I went without an internet connection for a few days and I could not register any Application Server without an internet connection. 

I just tried this PR and it solves the main problem of not been able to register an App Server. But it is throwing an exception which it should not. 
![NetBeans-Test_PR3018](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9832133/124816246-d003f080-df57-11eb-84ec-4f76e352172f.png)

Did cleanup Buildinfo, most of changes are groovy and jakarta related.

lots of removal like this 
```
hfds FOCUS_TRAVERSABLE_DEFAULT,FOCUS_TRAVERSABLE_SET,FOCUS_TRAVERSABLE_UNKNOWN,LOCK,acc,actionListenerK,adjustmentL```
and this
```hcls AWTTreeLock,BltSubRegionBufferStrategy,DummyRequestFocusController,FlipSubRegionBufferStrategy,ProxyCapabilities,SingleBufferStrategy
```

Apologies, I forgot that when the Ant build script runs it puts the downloaded files into `release` folder. 

With that your change is for sure valid, Go ahead and merge.

And yes, it is a good idea to move into own repo. It should be pretty straight-forward to do for this particular build, however you must

1. Remember to bring the GitHub Actions build script with you (https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/.github/workflows/native-binary-build-lib.profiler.yml)
1. Change (1) in the step(s) which generate the JNI headers. See the comments where it says "the sole purpose".
1. As a result there will be some changes needed to paths and what not in both the yaml file and the build-native script files.

I'll be happy to assist.
Is it possible to include this in `12.5` ?

@sdedic @jkovalsky @Akshay-Gupta-Oracle @singh-akhilesh 
If it's OK for you please feel free to merge this after commits are squashed. (Is the Travis error OK?)

> Is the Travis error OK?

Should be - it's a timeout (happens sometimes).

> Should be - it's a timeout (happens sometimes).

Too often :D,  Let's merge this
Maybe will need a more mavenized way to have source and binaries a easy to generate. I'm not aware of all native in the code base, will see later.
@pepness This looks ok and mergeable
can we make this for 12.5 @jlahoda ?
Filed [NETBEANS-5847](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5847) for Maven projects.

Looks like a nice usability improvement. Was the system even usable when your _custom rules_ got reset with every update to new version of NetBeans? Could you write documentation/blog post describing how you use the _advanced rule files_? I am sure @geertjanw would publish it somewhere!

>Looks like a nice usability improvement. Was the system even usable when your custom rules got reset with every update to new version of NetBeans?

I used to copy some configs manually when I updated NetBeans, rule files were just one item on the list, I also maintain my own etc/netbeans.conf, pointing to a different JDK location and with slightly different JVM flags.
(tried to improve the situation there too but I didn't anticipate the windows launcher https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/3002)

>Could you write documentation/blog post describing how you use the advanced rule files?

i wrote one a decade ago, quite dated by now :)
https://mbien.dev/blog/entry/you_have_won_the_jackpot

If I come up with a interesting use case I might write another one. Its just that I am often too lazy to write anything, esp when I also have the option to code instead.
Forgot to mention that this update fixes [NETBEANS-5556](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5556)
Thanks, merging.
Please merge, @ebarboni, whenever you're ready.
Ready to merge?
Discarded in favor of #3050
Oh, sorry, let me check the outstanding issues today...
I confirm fix of NETBEANS-5556 bug, thank you.
@junichi11 Please, let me know - again, heh - whether this PR can be merged. Thanks!
@tmysik We can merge it :)

@junichi11 

Will wait for the other reviewers and merge it later. Thanks!
@tmysik OK. Just in case, I added other reviewers. (Maybe, the feature freeze date is tomorrow(7/15).) Thanks!

The popup switcher bug was unrelated to this PR, and will probably require separate work/review. I also found a more serious bug in the popup switcher, which could make the IDE unresponsive (also unrelated to this PR). I added the following JIRA issues for these:

[NETBEANS-5853 Repaint problems in tabcontrol ButtonPopupSwitcher](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5853)
[NETBEANS-5855 Closing unsaved editor tab from dropdown can put IDE in unusable state](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5855)

Will now tweak the hover color...

Here's the tweaked hover color...

![New hover color](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/886243/125685393-7006e422-158a-42ba-9354-d1edc7b4753b.png)

Will do a force push to update this.
Merging after approval--thank you, @hectorespert !

I did a force push just to remove the now-unused ToolbarConfiguration.isWindows8() method, as earlier suggested. Other than that I think the discussion items were resolved here (judging by rasa-app's thumbs-up emoji :-).

I have used this patch in my working IDE and platform app for two months, so I think it should be safe to merge (once Travis passes again)...
I've had this patch running in my working IDE for two months now, and I think it should be safe to merge.
Not a big change, merging.
@jlahoda may I merge ? or should I do squash and merge
merging this

> No problemo, feel free to merge your others approved PR.

Hey @ebarboni , thanks very much for the help today!! That was exactly what I needed..

Float, eek! :smile:  Couldn't we reuse something like [SpecificationVersion](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/platform/openide.modules/src/org/openide/modules/SpecificationVersion.java) for this?

On the other aspect, I just noticed `12.4.301` in the previous versions list while building from master.  Do we really want that in there at all?  Could it cause any issue as it is?  Maybe just filter the list by those that parse as float first?
Using Specification Version looks better :D. This should allow to target previous version of NetBeans maybe for import settings. Not sure the better stragegy ignoring or generalizing.
seems ok may you merge it @eirikbakke ?
Yes, the patch has worked without problem on my IDE for the last month. Making these actions non-lazy seems to be the only way to get them to behave correctly.

This looks like a sane change, has positive reviews, does not introduce a revolution and seems to pretty much contained and is tested. I suggest to get this in now.

@eirikbakke minor comment for the future: I would add the issue marker to the commit messages themselves - its the individual commits, that are shown when running `git blame` (or the using the corresponding netbeans action) and it would make it easier to find the issue that motivated a change.
Looks sane, has positive review (with verification, that it fixes reported problems) and should have minimal impact. Lets get this in.
Thanks! @matthiasblaesing Sure, I will reference the issue in each individual commit message in the future.

If it matters, Glassfish 6.2 now exists.
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/glassfish/tags
Glassfish 6.2 includes Jakarta MVC
Thanks, yes I am working on support for Glassfish 6.2 and Jakarta EE 9.1.

@Chris2011 could you please give this a spin? This is a minimal approach to a CSS beautifier, that for now does not offer options to configure it, but IMHO improves the situation regarding CSS code, if you have minified or badly formatted CSS.

@jlahoda could you please have a look at this? The project I observed the massive times in showed a property list with > 70.000 entries and the sampling profiler from visual vm led me directly to the addItem method of EditableProperties.
Thx @matthiasblaesing will give it a try.
The referenced issue has screenshots of Netbeans on a current Ubuntu version for a first impression.

Well, I kind of like how this is working with the current implementation even with FlatLAF. FlatLAF paints the whole row as selected, but the row-popup context menu is only displayed if you right-click on the text. Otherwise the selection background clears and you get the project context popup.
It's not that consistent, maybe just the 10++ years wiring likes that in my brain.

@matthiasblaesing, sorry for trouble. Using `Properties` looks fine. It would also probably be enough to use `EditableProperties(false)` to avoid sorting (not sure why I used `true` anyway - probably no particular good reason).
Thanks for the review @lkishalmi
@jlahoda thank you for the review.
@ebarboni Can we include this in 12.5 yet?
@jGauravGupta thanks for the PR is the exception @pepness see solved ?
Yes we can
had to insist :D, It would be great to have it for 12.5.
I cannot test PHP maybe good to wait for @tmysik review ?

@ebarboni 
> I cannot test PHP

No problem.

> maybe good to wait for @tmysik review ?

Yes.

I saw your email (preparing for 12.5: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc9866241a10ef7deda1f9235426909fde433b988888e75049d0362b4%40%3Cdev.netbeans.apache.org%3E).
So, Just in case, I added you as a reviewer because I was not sure whether we can include this in 12.5. Thanks!

Thanks @JaroslavTulach

@ebarboni merging now so it's in by freeze, and before anyone decides they need to increment a spec version and cause a merge conflict. :smile:
Approved, merging then...
@tmysik Thank you for your review :)
@JaroslavTulach can we merge this or should it be postponed?

I have just seen that this PR should be rewritten and the applied only after applying #2902 .
In the comment of that PR I see that the author is working on adding the functionality of this PR to #2902, without knowing it's existence.
What 's the best way forward?
Yes @ebarboni
Can you rebase your branch onto master @jGauravGupta ? I get an error `java.lang.NumberFormatException: multiple points` when I run this PR.

I got another exception

@juneau001 file are in conflict would it be possible to fix so we may merge ?
seems easy to merge will wait a review first :D
Please merge as soon as all's green.
There doesn't seem to be an agreement, that this is the right fix.

Hi @pepness, 

I rebased the PR with the master branch. May you retest the PR again?
Hey @digiovinazzo what is the progress here? Can you please check the conversation that was started? :)
Hey @DevCharly can you please try to help here, that would be awesome :)

> This implementation is very raw, as far as I remember it can break the event processing a bit in the popup.

Yeah, there seems to be a serious bug in ButtonPopupSwitcher, unrelated to this PR:
[NETBEANS-5855 Closing unsaved editor tab from dropdown can put IDE in unusable state](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5855)

Might be good to get this fixed before doing additional changes around this class.

There's also a more cosmetic bug in the same class (discovered by @DevCharly ), filed here:
[NETBEANS-5853 Repaint problems in tabcontrol ButtonPopupSwitcher](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-5853)

> @juneau001 file are in conflict would it be possible to fix so we may merge ?

I will try to repair the conflict.  Thanks
CC: @ebarboni
Maybe, it's better to add it somewhere of Folding or PHP Options although I'm not sure whether we can do it easily. I don't think there are many users expecting it...
